subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “be able to; can; ability”
: ''{{w|Shijing}}'' rhymes point to Old Chinese *''nə'', but the forms with *''-ŋ'' are also archaic (perhaps ancient dialectal variation?).

: Possibly Sino–Tibetan: compare {{cog|bo|ནུས||be able to; capable; to withstand; capacity; strength; force; power; function; energy}}, {{cog|my|နိုင်||can, be able to, may; master; win; prevail}}. {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} also derives {{och-l|態|apparition, bearing, manner}} from this.

: Compare the old Sino–Vietnamese loanword {{m|vi|nổi||be able to; capable}}.
